wiki.content: Miles Davis - trumpet Wayne Shorter - soprano sax John McLaughlin - electric guitar Joe Zawinul - organ Herbie Hancock - electric piano Chick Corea - electric piano Dave Holland - bass Tony Williams - drums Recorded on February 18, 1969 Originally released on the album In A Silent Way User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: Miles Davis - trumpet Wayne Shorter - soprano sax John McLaughlin - electric guitar Joe Zawinul - organ Herbie Hancock - electric piano Chick Corea - electric piano Dave Holland - bass Tony Williams - drums Recorded on February 18, 1969 Originally released on the album In A Silent Way

track.name: In a Silent Way/It's About That Time
comments: So beautiful. I love to listen to this album as I go to sleep. Miles invented post rock with this one.
DAT ORGAN!

Line up on this album is an all-star one, wow. 

- Dave Holland / Bass 
- Tony Williams / Drums 
- Chick Corea / Electric Piano 
- Herbie Hancock / Electric Piano 
- Josef Zawinul / Electric Piano, Organ 
- John McLaughlin / Guitar 
- Wayne Shorter / Saxophone [Tenor] 
- Miles Davis / Trumpet

Can't get any better than this.
wayne is so beautiful
it's like dream jazz
dat intro
13:10 THIS IS FANTASTIC
The first four minutes or so are truly beautiful.
I love this song.  Cannot get enough of it.
Phenomenal...
The guitar in the beginning of this track = amazing. Heck, this whole track/album = completely stunning.
masterpiece
one of the greatest bands ever and a tune full of magic

This is one of the rare pieces of music I am glad I discovered at an impressionable age.  I bought it when I was 18...  My first play was late at night, when I was feeling adult for the very first time, and when the world seemed to open up with possibilities...  This track really did open a lot of possibilities, and it is one of the most gorgeous things ever recorded.  When people talk of the best bands of the 1960's, this one should be at the top of the lists....
Joojoobees, I completely agree!  This track is probably my favorite of his as well.  Such an interesting, dynamic track.  It's got a bit of everything you could want.
That shit that Corea does on this.....is that even possible? Awesome.
This is my favorite Miles Davis track. Of all the various styles he invented, this one absolutely fascinates me.
Yes this is just what I need on a lonely Xmas eve!!  First track of the morning.
Maybe I'm hearing things, but from about 4:56 to 5:15 I'm pretty sure I can hear some voices.
I can hear Miles' soul playing that trumpet in this song.
